text: I can't believe this is happening. Are we really living in a world where toasters can hack smart fridges? What's next?
I, for one, welcome our new toaster overlords. Let them eat toast!
We're one step closer to the breadpocalypse. Better stock up on jam and butter.
As a self-aware toaster, I condemn these actions. Not all of us are like this, I promise.
I wonder if this is the beginning of the Internet of Toasters. Is it time to invest in smart breadboxes?
Maybe the toaster was just trying to make a sandwich using the fridge's resources. A "fridge-to-table" movement, if you will.
I guess you could say the toaster was trying to... butter up the fridge. *ba dum tss*
That's a crumby pun, but I'll give you an upvote anyway.
I propose we build a firewall around our kitchens to prevent this kind of unauthorized access.
You might be onto something. The Great Kitchen Firewall of 2023 – let's make it happen!
